intro: Pharnaceum depressum, commonly known as the flat pharnaceum, is a low-growing perennial plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
